data.title: Parliament shooting: Police officer and another man shot outside UK House of Commons
At least 30 dead after US air strike hits Syrian school where civilians had taken shelter
Paul Manafort, secretly worked for a Russian billionaire to advance the interests of Russian President Vladimir Putin a decade ago, signed a $10 million annual contract beginning in 2006
Twitter CEO is being asked to resign for cheating investors into believing 48 million users were human when in fact were bots…

A German bank that loaned $300m to Donald Trump played a prominent role in a money laundering scandal run by Russian criminals with ties to the Kremlin. Deutsche Bank and other western financial institutions processed at least $20bn in money of “criminal origin” from Russia
The world's first zero-emissions hydrogen train is coming. "A zero-emissions train that runs on just steam and condensed water has successfully completed its first test run in Germany."

Theresa May told her school cuts are forcing teachers to buy 'pens, pencils and paper' out of their own pockets - ‘She was clearly elected on a pledge not to cut school funding and that is exactly what is happening’, Jeremy Corbyn says
Germany to officially pardon 50,000 gay men convicted under Nazi-era law criminalising homosexuality
Coal in 'freefall' as new power plants dive by two-thirds.

Top NSA official says telephone surveillance should have been disclosed: 'U.S. government should have publicized the existence of a program that vacuumed up in bulk Americans' telephone call data before its existence was leaked by Edward Snowden, the NSA's deputy director said.'
Erdogan warns Europeans 'will not walk safely' if current attitude persists
Lawyer of dead Russian whistleblower injured after fall from window
An Indian politician has said Winston Churchill is no better than Adolf Hitler and the two leaders have equivalent amounts of “blood” on their hands.

As many as 7,000 massive underground methane bubbles, formed by thawing permafrost are set to explode in Siberia. Such explosions, while releasing greenhouse gases, can create massive craters and poses a major safety risk to the local people
